com.brinfotech.feedbacksystem.customClas.android:text: During the day note any tendencies within your habitual patterns of thinking that you feel could lead to destructive habits, such as lust :), anger, vengeful, scheming, taking advantage of others, etc.. Becoming aware of these patterns while not acting upon them will over time help you to erase and release those patterns. When you observe those patterns or thoughts, consciously form a contrary thought. For example if you have a thought about wanting to hurt someone, create a contrary thought of loving them. One way is to see them as your mother, father, brother, sister, or someone that you love. A common exercise is to see everyone as your Mother because in Buddhism it is believed that we have had many many lifetimes as a soul and it is likely that person has been a mother to you. Thinking of all the sacrifice they would have made to raise you and take care of you, helps to alleviate angry thoughts and cultivates thoughts and feelings of gratitude. Gratitude is a fast path or short-cut to a higher state of consciousness.
